frequently invited to present their research at top business schools and academic conferences. They are immersed in the academic community, serve as editors or are on editorial review boards of many scholarly marketing journals including the Journal of Consumer Research, Marketing Science, Marketing Letters, the International Journal of Research in Marketing, and more. Several hold leadership positions in many professional organizations including the American Marketing Association, Association for Consumer Research, Society for Consumer Psychology, INFORMS to name a few. In fact, NYU Stern Marketing is ranked in the top 10 of the UT Dallas ranking of business schools based on research productivity in 2006 through 2013.                                       Faculty Spotlight                 Tülin Erdem     Professor of Marketing              Teaches Strategic Marketing, Planning & Implementation, and Marketing Concepts.       “Great colleagues, great school, and a magical city!” is how Professor Erdem describes being in Stern. She’s the editor-in-chief of the Journal of Marketing Research and is currently working on learning models (how consumers learn and choose) as well as a follow-up project to a paper about religion and brands as self-expression tools." Marketing Overview of the Center   Research & Knowledge Center   Events   Student Programs   Center News   Contact Us                                       Through cutting-edge research and innovative teaching methods, NYU Stern Marketing is shaping the business leaders of tomorrow.                Excellence in Marketing    At Stern, we strive towards marketing excellence by pioneering research in the industry and tackling real-world matters in the classroom. Ranked as one of the top five departments in the world based on research productivity, our department boasts of over 100 publications in the last three years, about two-thirds of which are in top-tier scholarly journals.        – Message from the Department Chair          I’m happy to report that this is an exciting time for the department: we have 30 full time tenure-track and clinical faculty--including three terrific young scholars, Andrea Bonezzi, Daria Dzyabura, and Masakazu Ishirara--faculty affiliates Bruce Buchanan, Yuxin Chen of NYU Shanghai, Anindya Ghose and Yaacov Trope, as well as over 40 adjunct faculty members.    Our research contributions continue to be both numerous and impactful. We have sustained our leadership roles in the field with Joel Steckel and Eitan Muller continuing their co-editorships of Marketing Letters and the International Journal of Research in Marketing respectively. Recent appointments include Vicki Morwitz as the new co-editor of the Journal of Consumer Research (JCR) and Russ Winer’s appointment as a Senior Editor of Marketing Science . Professional and school leadership positions continue to be a strong point as Geeta Menon continues in her position as Dean of the Undergraduate College, and Joel Steckel continues as Vice Dean of Doctoral Education. On the programmatic front, our courses and specializations in Entertainment, Media and Technology (EMT ), Luxury and Retail, and Digital Marketing continue to attract MBA and Undergraduate students.    Stern faculty research is frequently featured in The Wall Street Journal , Time , NPR , The New York Times , and other prestigious media outlets.    We are justifiably proud of our doctoral program, as it is one of the best in the world. Our placement record continues to be superb, and we are fortunate to have a strong current group of students. Over the last two years, we have placed students at Harvard Business School, Dartmouth's Tuck School of Business, The Chinese University of Hong Kong, and The Chinese Europe International Business School.    As you can see, our department is in a great place. We have outstanding faculty, a terrific support staff, and a vibrant student community. I hope that you become involved with our Department in some way in the near future.  .          Sincerely,   Priya Raghubir   Department Chair  Dean Abraham L. They first provide a general description of this methodology, discuss its advantages and disadvantages, and describe findings from previous single-neuron human research. Forthcoming in Marketing Research 's special section on Neuroscience and Marketing. R ead more .      Faculty Spotlights                Bruce Buchanan      Professor of Marketing     Bruce joined NYU Stern in 1983. He received his PhD in Business Economics from Columbia University. His research investigates Advertising Substantiation, Business Ethics and Policy, Marketing Strategy and Implementation, and     Corporate Governance.                                Thomai Serdari      Adjunct Associate Professor     Thomai joined Stern in 2012. She received her MBA from NYU Stern in 2009, and her PhD in Art History and Archaeology from NYU's Institute of     Fine Arts in 2005. She a strategist in luxury marketing and branding, and works to help clients launch, grow, and successfully manage luxury brands.     She is an expert on luxury and actively studies, values, and reports on companies or funds that operate and invest within the luxury goods market. Apply Now        Request Information        Events                                                                                 M.S. in Integrated Marketing          feature subtitle 1                                        Concentrations           Brand Management         Digital Marketing         Marketing Analytics               With the rapid evolution of new technologies and an increasingly sophisticated consumer population, it is crucial for companies and organizations to reach customers in new and innovative ways in order to gain the competitive edge. Jobs are growing in the field of marketing because social networking and new interactive methods of communicating with customers are demanding fresh ideas and new approaches. Competition is high for managerial positions in this field, and earning a master’s degree is one way to help your résumé stand out with recruiters and prospective employers.   The M.S. in Integrated Marketing program at the NYU School of Professional Studies prepares you with the theoretical knowledge, the analytical skills, and the most effective methodologies required to become a leader who is able to implement compelling marketing campaigns, to grow market share, and to increase an organization’s bottom line. Distinctive for the breadth and the depth of topics in which it immerses students, the program provides a strong foundation in finance, campaign management, strategic planning, database management and modeling, digital marketing, and leadership, all of which help you to anticipate and to address the needs of this ever-changing and exciting profession. You can specialize in key areas including: digital marketing, brand management, or marketing analytics.
